text: Sandwell is a metropolitan borough of the West Midlands county. It is named after the Sandwell Priory, and is densely populated. It includes the six towns of Oldbury, Rowley Regis, Smethwick, Tipton, Wednesbury, and West Bromwich. West Bromwich is the largest town in the borough. At the 2021 census, the borough had a population of 341,832 and an area of 86 square kilometres (33 sq mi). ==References== Category:Metropolitan boroughs in the West Midlands
title: Sandwell
